histcon module¶

‘Builds the HISTCON network.

histcon.inference(input_tensor)[source]¶

Build the HISTCON model.

Layer types:
conv: Convolutional layers with a kernel size and feature map size. pool: Pooling layers. norm: Normalization layers. local: Fully-connected layers. linear: final layer with linear transformation to produce logits.
Parameters:input_tensor – Images Tensor returned from distorted_inputs() or inputs().
Returns:Logits.
histcon.inputs()[source]¶

Construct processed input for HISTCON training.

Returns:Images. 4D tensor of [batch_size, IMAGE_SIZE, IMAGE_SIZE, 3] size. labels: Labels. 1D tensor of [batch_size] size.
Return type:images
Raises:ValueError – if no data_dir
histcon.loss(logits, labels)[source]¶

Add L2Loss to all trainable variables, and a summary for “Loss” and “Loss/avg”.

Parameters:
  • logits – Logits from inference().
  • labels – Labels from distorted_inputs() or inputs(). 1D tensor of shape [batch_size]
Returns:

Loss Tensor of type float.
histcon.train(total_loss, global_step)[source]¶

Train the HISTCON model.

Create an optimizer and apply to all trainable variables. Add moving average for all trainable variables.

Parameters:
  • total_loss – Total loss from loss().
  • global_step – Integer variable counting the number of training steps processed.
Returns:

op for training.
Return type:

train_op
